Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Measurement Accuracy of Digital Vernier Caliper and Digital Thickness Gauge for Venous Specimens

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial used 12 porcine vena cava specimens from pigs aged 18-24 weeks.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial used 12 porcine vena cava specimens from pigs aged 18-24 weeks.

Intervention.evidence: Measurements were performed using a digital vernier caliper (four protocols) and a digital thickness gauge (one protocol).

Objective.evidence: This study compares the accuracy of a digital vernier caliper and a digital thickness gauge.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the consistency and accuracy of thickness measurements over three consecutive trials.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial used 12 porcine vena cava specimens from pigs aged 18-24 weeks.

Result_Outcome.evidence: In the first protocol, lower values were observed during the first measurement compared to the second (0.409 ± 0.063 vs. 0.536 ± 0.064, p < 0.0001) and third (0.409 ± 0.063 vs. 0.528 ± 0.055, p = 0.0001).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details are not applicable.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details are not applicable.
